data.title: Function arguments are not suggested in the debug repl
Methods on the object prototype are not suggested in the debug repl
First line cropped from integrated terminal
Windows: lost ability to find files within > 255 characters path
data.body:
Testing https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/11035
- create a path > 255 characters on Windows
- try to find it via quick open

=> you can no longer find files via quick open that have a longer path than 255 characters

data.title: Windows: Investigate writing native library / command line tool for file traversal

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Testing https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/11035
- open a path in VS Code using UNC loopback (e.g. \localhost\c$\GitDevelopment\vscode)
- quick open to find a file

=> it takes a lot longer compared to our raw node.js solution in 1.4
=> maybe we need to detect UNC cases and avoid using dir command

data.title: Multiple hanging dir/find commands for large searches
data.body:
Testing https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/11035
- setup symlinks in a way that you end up having circular references for a large workspace (I was using the VS Code repository to have meaningful large data)
- use quick open to find a file
- watch the processes that get spawned
- due to https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/11179 we end up doing a lot more work than needed
- close quick open
- open quick open and run the same search again

=> you see more and more dir commands piling up (interestingly the second time you try it seems 2 new dir commands popup instead of one)
=> I would expect the command to be killed when another one starts

![screen shot 2016-08-30 at 10 12 38](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/18084499/ce525a9a-6ea7-11e6-9e72-b0c739bcee91.png)

data.title: Vim: <kbd>ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>d</kbd> doesn't work
data.body:
testing #11127:

<kbd>ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>d</kbd> and ðŸ”¢ <kbd>ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>d</kbd> neither work on macOS nor on Windows 10 (I'm using a Swiss-German keyboard).

data.title: Windows: circular symlinks protection lost
data.body:
Testing https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/11035
- setup symbols links in a way that you introduce cycles
- use quick open 

=> you notice that the circular symlinks are followed until possibly you reach max file path limit on Windows (255)

data.title: File with complete match is not shown first in Quick open
data.body:
Testing #11106 
1. Assume that you have two files **color.ts** and **color.test.ts**
2. Open **color.test.ts** so that it will be in Recently opened list
3. In Quick open type color.ts

Expected: First match should be **color.ts** file
Observed: **color.test.ts** from Recently opened sections is shown first

![screen shot 2016-08-30 at 11 33 02](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10746682/18083913/8cc25b04-6ea5-11e6-9126-570e423f970a.png)

data.title: Quick open perform slow when includeSymbols settings is true
data.body:
Testing #11106
Steps to Reproduce:

Set up:

```
"search.quickOpen.includeSymbols": true
```
1. Open VS Code dev workspace. It has two files **editorStyles.ts** and **editorState.ts**
2. Open editorStyles.ts file
3. Quick Open => search for **editorS**

Observed: Quick open is slow - See the attached videos comparison

Insiders:

![aug-30-2016 11-12-49](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10746682/18083329/fca8d50e-6ea2-11e6-91d3-e3f368e59577.gif)

Stable:

![aug-30-2016 11-14-09](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10746682/18083342/075ea640-6ea3-11e6-9e52-d539275e04e7.gif)

data.title: File events broken when opening workspace outside of a VM

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Might be expected.
1. Have a win VM on your mac, open vscode inside the win VM
2. In vscode open a repository which lives on a drive asociated with the mac
3. Notice file events are broken

![screen shot 2016-08-30 at 11 11 11](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/18083212/7baa0e0a-6ea2-11e6-8df9-65480240ed8a.png)

data.title: `provideWorkspaceSymbols` should still be called with an empty query
data.body:
Testing #11113

I see the performance complications, but shouldn't it be up to each workspace symbol provider to decided whether or not to show items on an empty query?

data.title: Extensions should auto update when searched for in the Marketplace
data.body:
Refs #11119
1. Enable "extensions.autoUpdate"
2. Notice that outdated extensions only get auto updated on vscode startup. They do not get updated when you search for extensions in the viewlet which should update the extensions model

data.title: Quick open is not showing requested Symbol after Reload
data.body:
Testing #11106
Steps to Reproduce:

Set up:

```
"workbench.settings.openDefaultSettings": false,
"search.quickOpen.includeSymbols": true
```
1. Open a File say **editorStyles.ts** from VS Code dev
2. <kbd>cmd</kbd>+<kbd>p</kbd> search for **EditorStyleSettings**
3. Quick open shows the requested Symbol - Good
4. Open settings - <kbd>cmd</kbd>+<kbd>,</kbd>
5. **editorStyles.ts** and **Settings** are in two tabs in the same editor group. **Settings** is active
6. Reload the window
7. **editorStyles.ts** and **Settings** are in two tabs in the same editor group. **Settings** is active
8. Repeat Step 2 

Observed: No results for Symbol **EditorStyleSettings**

data.title: Stable input from extension does not resolve when opening another picker
data.body:
Testing https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/11108
- run an extension that opens a stable quick open picker
- click on any other picker (NOT quick open - e.g. encoding from the status bar)

=> the extension does not get any return value as result
=> the new picker stays open even though this is not how the picker was configured with in the first place

data.title: If VSCode is opened first, Webpack cannot use any loaders (Node 6).
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: Windows 7/10

Since I upgraded my Node version to 6, I have a strange bug with my Node/Webpack/VSCode combo that I can reproduce on both my home and work PCs, but not on my colleagues' that are still on Node 5.

Basically, if I open VSCode first, I cannot start any webpack build from either the built-in console, the built-in tasks or even an external console (that had been opened after) without having it fail right away because it cannot use any loader. I use Typescript and I get an error at the first 'non-standard' feature webpack encounters saying it needs a loader to handle that file. I get the error with both `awesome-typescript-loader` and `ts-loader`.

But if I open an external console first and then VSCode, then, in that console, I can launch all my builds without issues, even if VSCode is opened.

This isn't blocking in any way, that it's pretty restrictive (and weird).

data.title: Recent folders list changes when opening folder in extension debug window
data.body:
- Open an extension workspace
- `F5`
- Open folder in debuggee window

Maybe that folder shouldn't come into the recently opened folders list.

data.title: Seeing disconnect action when debugging extension
data.body:
- Start debugging
- Press `Stop` before the window shows up

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/18080877/8e7a16fc-6e97-11e6-864e-a7d1b2ad379d.png)

We should have the `Stop` action there instead.

data.title: TS: warn user when the globally installed version is 2.0 and tsdk isn't set
data.body:
TS 2.0 will become available in September and users will switch. To avoid the confusion that on the command line they are using 2.0 but inside vscode they are using 1.8 we should warn the user.
- run tsc --version on the command line to check the version
- if the tsdk setting isn't defined then inform the user that they should set it

data.title: Add `Update all extensions` as a workbench command
data.body:
Refs: #11119

Extensions viewlet > all the actions under ... are global workbench actions except update all extensions.
I would expect this also to be a global workbench action for consistency.

![screen shot 2016-08-30 at 09 49 33](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/18080791/3732db36-6e97-11e6-9e57-34efa073266d.png)

data.title: Check for Updates does not work
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.1
- OS Version: Win7

When I do a "Check for Updates..." in the Help menu it says "There are no updates currently available.". But I am running version 1.2.1 and I know that there is a new version "July 2016 (version 1.4)"?

data.title: The sidebar lacks Save and Open File buttons.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.0-insider
- OS Version: Windows 10

The two most basic, most used functions are missing buttons on the sidebar, and yet there's plenty of space and there's even an "Extensions" button. How times does anybody use that? Reminds me of the old Photoshop UI.

data.title: Unsupported format for ecmascript-rest-spread
data.body:
![0d17f687-2426-4fe4-958c-12b537d7ac77](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1203827/18078403/ea9a15f6-6ebd-11e6-8338-b7df390936ac.png)

.editorconfig

```
root = true

[*]
charset = utf-8
end_of_line = lf
indent_style = space
indent_size = 4
trim_trailing_whitespace = true
insert_final_newline = false

[package.json]
indent_style = space
indent_size = 2
```

I can't bear it

data.title: Electron Update 1.x
data.body:
Fixes https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/10206

This comes with the following framework updates:
- **Electron** 0.37.6 => 1.3.4
- **Chrome** 49 => 52
- **V8** 49 => 52
- **node.js** 5.10 => 6.3.0
- **libuv** 1.8 => 1.9.1

**Changelog**: 
- Electron: https://github.com/electron/electron/releases
- node.js: https://github.com/nodejs/node/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md
- libuv: https://github.com/libuv/libuv/blob/v1.x/ChangeLog
